conclusion: Consider contributions from each of the four point charges at the vertices of the square.
Intersection of diagonals is the center of the square; distance from center to any vertex is L/sqrt(2).
Electric field due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2 in direction of unit vector r.
Electric field at center due to charge at A is 2kq/L^2 directed from A to center.
Electric field at center due to charge at B is 2kq/L^2 directed from B to center.
Electric field at center due to charge at C is -2kq/L^2 directed from center to C.
Electric field at center due to charge at D is -2kq/L^2 directed from center to D.
Net electric field along AC is 0 due to opposite fields from A and C.
Net electric field along BD is 0 due to opposite fields from B and D.
Total electric field at intersection of diagonals is zero.
